snippet: On a wild, whirling first day of free agency, Steve Nash emerged as the N.B.A.’s most coveted player and the Nets as the league’s most active player in trying to keep Deron Williams.
abstract: Brooklyn Nets sign four-year contract with forward Gerald Wallace as NBA's free agency season begins, and continue their frantic effort to re-sign star guard Deron Williams.
lead_paragraph: On a wild, whirling first day of free agency, Steve Nash emerged as the N.B.A.’s most coveted player and the Nets as the league’s most active player in trying to keep Deron Williams.

headline.seo: Nets Get Busy, as Free Agency Begins
headline.main: Nets Get Busy Trying to Persuade Williams to Stay
headline.print_headline: As Free Agency Begins, Nets Get Busy Trying to Persuade Williams to Stay
